RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Signal Oil & Gas Co. v. Barge W-701: Signal Oil & Gas Co. v. Barge W-701

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso: defendant in a criminal case involving cocaine discovered during an immigration stop, argued against the United States of America's right to appeal the judgment for acquittal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: party in the appeal, responsible for filing notice of appeal within specified deadlines, considered evidence during bench trial of Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.law of the case doctrine: judicial principle restricting reexamination of issues decided on appeal to ensure efficiency and consistency
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Article III: constitutional provision governing the jurisdiction of federal courts
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Signal Oil & Gas Co. v. Barge W-701: legal precedent establishing the law of the case doctrine in the 5th Circuit
